title: Data Steward I
description:
Company Overview

Tell us your story. Don’t go unnoticed. Explain why you’re a winning candidate. Think “TD” if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here’s our story: jobs.td.com

Department Overview

The TD Securities Chief Data Office (TDS-CDO) aims to operate, organize, govern and monetize TDS data assets. This is achieved through four strategic pillars:

  • Make Data Accessible
  • Secure & Govern Data
  • Create Tools & Enable Others to Use Them
  • Derive Value from Data

In doing so, the TDS-CDO enables the dealer with a focus on:

  • Grow: Service clients, monetize data & allocate resources
  • Protect: Manage Risk & Regulatory Compliance
  • Standardize: Achieve technology & operational efficiencies
  • Develop: Data Driven Culture

Job Description

About this Role

Reporting to the AVP, Data Governance in the Chief Data Office, the Data Steward I will be responsible to support the implementation of data governance and related data management activities for TD Securities.

Job Accountabilities:

  • Support the TDS-CDO in accordance with the Enterprise Data Policy, Standards and Strategy
  • Provides data governance expertise and executes data governance activities
  • Contribute to various operational activities and processes as assigned
  • Be knowledgeable of data management practices and procedures within own area of responsibility and keep abreast of emerging trends for own functional area
  • Assist and help drive the automation of the Data management practices including metadata, data lineage, authoritative sources, data usage, data quality rules, etc.
  • Be knowledgeable of data management tools related to metadata, lineage, data quality, etc. (e.g.: Collibra, Alation, Informatica, Ataccama, etc.)
  • Advises and consults with projects related to implementation of data management practices during system development (data impact analysis, quality controls, data lineage, etc.)
  • Develop and/or prepare applicable business metrics / standard / ad hoc reporting in collaboration with partners and stakeholders for data governance/management area to help inform or support decisions as appropriate
  • Conduct internal and external research projects; support the development / delivery of presentations / communications to management or broader audience
  • Conduct reporting and / or meaningful analysis at the functional or enterprise level using results to draw conclusions, make recommendations, assess the effectiveness of programs/ policies /
  • Support the development of presentations /communications and dissemination of information
  • Coordinate relevant processes /meetings /events that impact the TDS-CDO’s practices
  • Understand department objectives and contribute by recommending appropriate action to management based on analysis and review of results within assigned scope
  • Monitor service, productivity and assess efficiency levels within own function and implement continuous process / performance improvements where opportunities exist
  • Acquire and apply expertise in the discipline, provide guidance, assistance and direction to others
  • Adhere to internal policies/procedures and applicable regulatory guidelines
  • Keep abreast of emerging issues, trends, and evolving regulatory requirements and assess potential impacts
  • Maintain a culture of risk management and control, supported by effective processes in alignment with risk appetite
  • Consistently exercise discretion in managing correspondence, information and all matters of confidentiality; escalate issues where appropriate

Requirements

What can you bring to TD? Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:

Education/Accreditations:

  • Undergraduate degree or technical certificate and/or
  • 5+ years relevant experience

Other Qualifications/Skills/Experience:

  • Solid knowledge of data governance/data management practices, enterprise data policy, standards &strategy
  • Solid knowledge of LOB data strategy, data risk management, and data life cycle management
  • Knowledge of current and emerging competitor and market trends
  • Skill in using analytical software tools, data analysis methods and reporting techniques
  • Skill in using computer applications including MS Office
  • Ability to communicate effectively in both oral and written form
  • Ability to work collaboratively and build relationships
  • Ability to work successfully as a member of a team and independently
  • Ability to exercise sound judgement in making decisions
  • Ability to analyze, organize and prioritize work while meeting multiple deadlines
  • Ability to handle confidential information with discretion
  • Knowledge of Basel Data Management Framework is desirable

title: Manager, Data Engineering (MDM)
description:
Description

Our team and what we’ll accomplish together

We are searching for a talented candidate to become our team’s Manager, MDM & Business Operations Insights. Reporting to the Director – Enterprise Data Engineering, the successful candidate will be responsible for leading a team of accomplished data analysts, engineers and architects supporting our data and analytics platform transformation. This role will be an agent of change and support the evolving strategy, data and analytics roadmaps of the enterprise data engineering team. The portfolio will focus specifically on the Master Data Management (MDM) workstream while also driving continuous improvement to our GCP engineering practices (common ingestion framework), CI/CD pipelines, DevOps, SRE, batch and real-time data ingestion, and addressing technical debt. Our team is a cloud first team and leverages the latest technologies to fuel our mission of driving value for TELUS via data enablement.

What you’ll do

At TELUS, we put ‘Customers First’. With a broad set of responsibilities and a high degree of visibility across the TELUS organization, the successful candidate will have the opportunity to:

  • Lead a team of talented data Analysts, Engineers and Architects to drive the modernization of our data platforms
  • Foster internal and external stakeholder relationships, including managing senior executive participants
  • Provide guidance to establish standards and best practices for building enterprise grade data pipelines
  • Work with our preferred Cloud service providers to align our roadmap based on their release schedule for services and product offerings
  • Construct comprehensive business cases and financial models leveraging various methods to support strategic projects and decisions with data driven insights
  • Utilize internal and external data points coupled with market research on marketplace dynamics impacting TELUS and the Data Strategy team to inform opportunities and risks for the team
  • Create technology roadmaps for business partners, executive management, and external audiences to enhance strategic decision making and support technology investment recommendations
  • Collaborate with key stakeholders to create, track and evolve the team scorecards and strategic imperatives
  • Support the annual strategic and financial planning process
  • Flex your communication, negotiation, and influencing skills, working with a broad set of internal stakeholders, executives and external partners
  • Mentor, lead, and support a diverse and very talented team of data professionals

Qualifications

What you bring

  • You have experience in technical leadership, managing data platforms, business intelligence tools and setting architectural direction
  • You can communicate clearly and effectively in both technical and business matters able to translate technical considerations into business implications
  • You are analytical and outcome-oriented with a proven ability to translate business requirements into high-level design models
  • You have hands on knowledge of foundational cloud data architecture of lakes, warehouses, data modeling, and life cycle management
  • You have demonstrated experience with the governance and oversight of data privacy, security and the ethical use of data in previous roles
  • You have experience with cloud migration projects, agile methodologies, and DevOps practices
  • You have impressive people leadership track record with proven ability to recruit, coach, mentor and lead high performing teams in a fast-paced environment
  • You are a skilled relationship builder and skilled at prioritization, negotiation and influencing
  • You can pivot between supporting the urgent needs of the business and the long-term roadmap
  • You are flexible, adaptable and embrace ongoing change
  • You have experience working on and supporting large, complex technical projects that involve multiple stakeholders and business units
  • You have exposure to tools, technologies and programming languages including, but not limited to, Python, Airflow (composer), SQL, Apache Nifi, Hive, Spark, Dataflow (Apache Beam), Kafka, MDM, IICS & PowerCentre ETL
  • You have experience creating a vision for and implementing a culture of change to drive CI/CD, DevOps and other opportunities for operational effectiveness

Great-to-haves

  • Bachelor of Computer Science or equivalent
  • 5+ years of progressive and relevant work experience with enterprise data
  • PMP certification is an asset
  • Experience with the data offerings in the Google Cloud Platform
  • Experience in the telecommunications industry
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to lead a large team

  • Experience with R, Python, AWS Sage Maker
  • Experience with Agile or design-driven development of analytics applications
  • PMP and/or Scrum Master certification
  • Experience with optimization and tuning of large data extracts for Tableau

title: Data Engineer, Finance Data
description:
Vision and Core Values

OMERS overall vision is to play a leadership role in the pension industry and be first of class, deliver superior services and to grow and attract investment partners. The core values are to be fair, have high integrity, respect for each other, provide superior service and work as a team.

The Corporate Objectives for OMERS is to provide secure pensions for all their constituents by:

  • Investing to earn outstanding returns with due regard for risk
  • Partnering with like-minded investment managers
  • Providing high quality service to our members and employers
  • Delivering value for money
  • Building a culture of excellence and pride in OMERS

OMERS Operating Principles are: Financial Strength, Accountability, Member Focus, Talent and Reporting.

Value Proposition

We’d be thrilled to have you join our team as we set up our Capital Markets Finance Data team for new and continued success! We’ll focus equally on expertise and excellence, paired with culture and community. We will serve OMERS teams primarily in Capital Markets, Total Portfolio Management, and the Corporate function through understanding their needs, delivering against their expectations, and contributing our proficiencies – to achieve collective wins. This role joins a team on a journey, with much future potential in a global, sophisticated, complex enterprise.

Scope: The Data Engineer is responsible for supporting the investment teams by enabling robust and reliable investment data, analytics, and reporting through investment technology and change management at one of Canada’s largest pension funds having assets exceeding $120 Billion.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and help maintain data assets to extract, transform, and load data from various data files, APIs, and databases, and to make them accessible to various client-facing applications as well as investment data warehouse and internal tools
  • Implement data strategies that prepare, transform, combine and manage structured and unstructured data (e.g. internal investment accounting systems as well as external third-party investment feeds) to integrate the data into an investment data warehouse and BI solutions
  • Develop and operate highly scalable data pipelines and infrastructure that enable investment analytics, and investment reporting use cases
  • Automate manual processes and optimize data delivery
  • Utilize modern technologies for designing and building data solutions to meet business needs
  • Partner with business analysts and reporting analysts to develop reports and PowerBI dashboards
  • Support and troubleshoot existing investment data applications and BI reporting solutions as needed
  • Work as part of a cross-functional agile team responsible for end-to-end delivery of business needs
  • Collaborate and work effectively with business analysts and reporting analysts team members, and other investment professionals and leaders in solutioning and support

Qualifications:

  • Track of record working in a fast-paced environment and multi-faceted role that intersects with business and technical analysts to support existing solutions, solution delivery, and contributions as a project resource for investment system implementations and upgrades
  • Strong experience with data management, investment systems, business intelligence, and other reporting technologies
  • Experience with Microsoft based BI/ETL tools (e.g. SQL Server, SSRS, SSIS, data factory) or similar
  • Experience with Cloud based data and analytics platforms (e.g. Snowflake, DataBricks, Azure Synapse)
  • Deep proficiency in SQL, Python, and similar languages
  • Good understanding of investment products
  • Demonstrated ability to handle multiple projects and tasks at the same time to support daily production issues
  • Critical thinking skills with the ability to independently solve problems with data and/or reference documents
  • Investment data modeling experience using the Kimball method is an asset
  • Experience with BNY Eagle PACE, Calypso, and Charles River is an asset
  • Data governance experience is an asset
  • Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Finance, or a related field

And you demonstrate:

  • A people-first focus with a desire to develop meaningful, positive relationships across all levels of the organization
  • A teammate mentality coupled with servant leadership
  • A sense of urgency, optimism, and a desire to deliver excellence
  • A desire to drive debate, to speak candidly, and to listen empathetically
  • Strong orientation towards strategy, change, and results
  • A continuous improvement mindset

Our story:

Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $124 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2022. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with more than 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.

What is the opportunity?

Global Risk Analytics (GRA) is the center of expertise for models used in risk management. This includes risk analytics for market risk, counterparty credit risk and emerging risk. GRA’s analytics innovation team focuses on emerging risks, including machine learning and climate analytics.

Given the large size of market data, data analytics (e.g., using advanced techniques such as machine learning) are needed to provide business insights. In addition, having an intelligent data visualization platform would bring the analytical presentation to the next level. As a result, GRA is developing a Dashboard web application for this purpose. This web application would serve as a centralized platform to host various data analytics dashboards.

Further, due to increasing importance of assessing the impacts of climate change to financial institutions, GRA is also building expertise in climate risk analytics to support RBC’s various climate risk stress testing and scenario analysis mandates (e.g., CCAR in US, ICAAP in UK). In particular, GRA has the model development ownership for several regional climate risk scenario analysis models, covering both transition risk (posed to clients in transition to low-carbon economy) and physical risk (posed by acute weather events) for different asset classes (e.g., corporate bond, municipal bonds, real estate, and wholesale loans).

Climate analytics is an emerging field. Institutions around the world (e.g., regulators, banks, vendors, etc.) are grappling with the challenges in how to enhance the data, scenario design, and methodology. At this stage, GRA is currently developing a unified platform to onboard different “climate risk + machine learning” modules, and potentially utilizing open-source data (if deemed appropriate) for research purposes.

GRA is seeking an individual who is interested in applying data analytics (including machine learning) and programming skills to empower our climate risk analytics capability. title: Cloud Applications Engineer
description:
Make a difference in brain research and innovation in Ontario   

The Ontario Brain Institute (OBI) is a provincially‐funded, not‐for‐profit initiative seeking to maximize the impact of neuroscience and establish Ontario as a world leader in brain discovery, commercialization and care. Convergent partnerships are created between researchers, clinicians, industry, patients, and their advocates to foster discovery and deliver innovative products and services that improve the lives of those living with brain disorders.   

The OBI is passionate about the outcomes of its work, the people and organizations it partners with, and the opportunity to play a role in shaping the future. Its members are united in the common goal to improve brain health. The culture is fast-paced, challenging and rewarding.   

If you are interested in joining the OBI team, please check out the employment opportunities at: http://www.braininstitute.ca/opportunities 

Cloud Applications Engineer - 1 Position

OBI is looking for an experienced Cloud Applications Engineer to join its Neuroinformatics team. This role will play a key part in supporting OBI related research projects that produce, share, and analyze high quality neuroscience data to advance neuroscience and brain discoveries via Brain-CODE. Brain-CODE is OBI’s large scale neuroinformatics platform for the collection, curation, sharing, and analysis of neuroscience data.

The ideal candidate will have a passion for advancing neuroscience informatics (neuroinformatics) via the adoption and scaling of advanced data tooling, computing, and AI on the cloud. Candidates should have significant experience working on cloud application management, deployment and support, preferably with experience in the health research ecosystem or similar.

This position will be a great opportunity for the successful candidate to develop their cloud DevOps and application stack management skills, work with new technologies for cloud big data and analytics, collaborate with national and international partners, and significantly participate in supporting the advancement of brain discovery and innovation for health impact.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead technical cloud data and application layers for health research data storage, sharing, and analysis on Microsoft Azure cloud and connected computing environments.
  • Design and implement platform and application services architectures according to cloud best practices for security, usability, performance, and cost.
  • Implement and support core applications and data pipelines stacks on cloud leveraging virtual machines, storage containers, databases, containerized applications, and scalable computing (e.g., Kubernetes, Azure App Services) in accordance with OBI cloud informatics guidelines.
  • Implement and support data management, cloud data storage services using Azure native and third-party storage solutions, databases, and file systems.
  • Implement and support cloud API stack and micro-service integrations and third-party data federations to facilitate data access, computing access and exchanges.
  • Implement and support cloud Analytics/ML services including virtual machines, analytical computing (CPUs, GPUs, TPUs, etc.).
  • Manage and support application user accounts, user access requests, and data preparation for user access.
  • Support security assessments, change management, and implement contingency plans for system upgrades while providing impact analysis and recommendation for system updates.
  • Support the development of OBI cloud application guidelines and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) as required.
  • Operate cloud resource budgets with due diligence and planning with the OBI informatics team.
  • Collaborate with third-party DevOps and Security providers, Microsoft Azure partners, and other third-party partners to advance neuroinformatics objectives.
  • Work closely with the OBI neuroinformatics team and service providers with agility and adapt to ongoing requirements changes.
  • Keep abreast of and communicate cloud application and data standards, cloud technology trends and innovation opportunities.

Skills & Qualifications:

  • 5 to 7+ years of experience with preference given to candidates with health research cloud systems experience; relevant MSc or PhD, an asset.
  • Preference will be given to Microsoft Azure cloud experience and certification, however candidates with other cloud experience (public or private) are welcome to apply.
  • Proven ability to adopt agile methodology for systems design, implementation, and support of cloud applications, data and computing resources, including virtual machines, databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MongoDB), containerization (e.g., Docker, Singularity), cluster management (Kubernetes, Azure App Services), REST API integration, and Git code versioning.
  • Experience with Python framework ecosystems (FastAPI, Flask, Jupyter Notebooks, Streamlit, etc.) with health data modelling services (REST API, GraphQL, FHIR, OMOP) preferred.
  • Experience with CLI based cloud management and orchestrating infrastructure as code (az-cli, bicep, terraform, etc.), writing shell scripts, files, and ops code for deployments, resource management, keys, cryptography, etc. using security best practices (e.g., bash, python, javascript, java, json, etc.).
  • Experience with sensitive data management and ETL (health data experience preferred).
  • Experience working with federated identity applications and management (e.g., SAMBA, OAuth, etc.).
  • Experience with cloud applications and storage security best practices (e.g., TLS, VPC, API security, CORS, container security, etc.)
  • Robust understanding of Microsoft Azure cloud infrastructure and platform management for computing, networking, and storage.
  • Microsoft Azure DevOps, Applications, AI Engineer, and/or Developer certifications an asset.
  • Experience operating with cloud resource budgets, quotas, and support.
  • Possesses excellent analytical and problem resolution skills.
  • Excellent communication skills and English proficiency with a willingness to teach and share lessons learned with the neuroinformatics team.
  • Excellent autonomy along with great collaboration skills.
  • A strong desire to make an impact in brain discovery and patient health.

The Cloud Application Engineer will work alongside the Data Systems Engineer, the Data Quality Analysts, the informatics service providers to OBI, and the broader neuroinformatics team.

We are a diverse, highly energized, passionate, professional and committed team. We offer an exciting workplace with many opportunities for learning. Qualified candidates are invited to submit a cover letter and resume, by September 10, 2023.

title: Member of Technical Staff, Data Acquisition
description:
Who are we?
We’re a small, diverse team working at the cutting edge of machine learning. At Cohere, our mission is to build machines that understand the world and to make them safely accessible to all. Language is at the crux of this, but it can be difficult and expensive to parse the syntax, semantics, and context that all work together to give words meaning. The Cohere platform provides access to Large Language Models through its APIs that read billions of web pages and learns to understand the meaning, sentiment, and intent of the words we use in a richness never seen before.

We've recently raised our Series C, and we are focused on bringing our technology to market. We will partner with customers so they can build natural language understanding and generation into their products with just a few lines of code.

We’re ambitious — we believe our technology will fundamentally transform how industries interact with natural language. And we have the technical chops to back it up - Cohere’s CEO, Aidan Gomez, is a co-author of the groundbreaking paper “Attention is all you need”, and was previously part of Google Brain. Our entire technical team is world-class.

We are focused on creating a diverse and inclusive work environment so that all of our team members can thrive. We welcome kind and brilliant people to our team, from wherever they come.

Why this role?
At Cohere, we strive to continually improve our large language models. Academic research and real-world experience has demonstrated that high quality, diverse datasets can contribute as much to the performance and capabilities of LLMs as the underlying model architecture and training regimen. We at Cohere believe data will play a central role in accelerating the advancement of our already world-class language models.

Data is therefore critical to our success. Our ability to acquire data that is accurate, relevant, and timely is key to our ability to improve the quality of our models. We strive to continuously improve our data acquisition processes and systems to ensure that we have the data we need to stay competitive and meet the needs of our customers. We run frequent experiments to learn more about the role of data for model quality, from data mixtures, to cleaning techniques, to quality control.

This role will be part of the Data Acquisition team, which broadly provides data for training models and is responsible for building and maintaining the infrastructure that acquires, cleans, and formats data for model training. We are looking for a technically skilled, resourceful problem-solver who is able to work in areas of ambiguity and find efficient and sometimes creative solutions. The main responsibility of this role is to improve our internal data acquisition infrastructure, which includes data crawlers, formatters, and integrations with data providers. This role would also work closely with different teams at Cohere to support their data acquisition needs, as well as engage in more experimental work to develop highly informative data signals.

Please Note: We have offices in Toronto, Palo Alto, and London but embrace being remote-first! There are no restrictions on where you can be located for this role.

As a Member of Technical Staff, Data Acquisition, you will:

    • Develop data pipelines to acquire, prepare, and integrate high-quality datasets into model training and evaluation
    • Collaborate with research and product teams to identify, prioritize, and secure new data sources
    • Enhance and develop infrastructure for data management, pipeline orchestration, and MLOps, while avoiding premature optimization
    • Run experiments using new data inputs, preprocessing techniques, and data mixtures

You may be a good fit if:

    • You have more than 2 years of experience working on a software or machine learning engineering team
    • You have proficiency in Python and have used distributed processing technologies like Spark, Dask, etc.
    • You have experience building data pipelines and ETL processes for large-scale datasets
    • You have experience working with unstructured and/or human-annotated data (e.g., collecting or assessing sample quality).
    • You have experience with ML frameworks such as Tensorflow, TF-Serving, JAX, and XLA/MLIR
    • You have strong communication and problem-solving skills, preferring the right tool for the job even if it’s outside your wheelhouse
    • You feel comfortable actively reading academic literature and researching state-of-the-art NLP best practices.
    • You have a demonstrated passion for applied NLP models and products
If some of the above doesn’t line up perfectly with your experience, we still encourage you to apply! If you consider yourself a thoughtful worker, a lifelong learner, and a kind and playful team member, Cohere is the place for you.

We value and celebrate diversity and strive to create an inclusive work environment for all. We welcome applicants of all kinds and are committed to providing an equal opportunity process. Cohere provides accessibility accommodations during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Our Perks:
🤝 An open and inclusive culture and work environment
🧑‍💻 Work closely with a team on the cutting edge of AI research
🍽 Free daily lunch

title: Associate Director, Environmental & Social Risk Analytics
description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director, Environmental & Social Risk Analytics

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

As part of the Environmental & Social Risk Analytics team within Group Risk Management, you will play a role in the management, monitoring, and mitigation of environmental and social (E&S) risks at RBC. You will support and lead the design and implementation of key climate and E&S risk initiatives by providing research and data analytics and insights.

A significant focus of this role will be the calculation of RBC’s financed emissions across different asset classes within carbon-intensive sectors and setting and tracking progress on net-zero targets.

What will you do?

  • Work with the Director, E&S Risk Analytics to assist in the advancement of RBC’s capabilities in measuring financed emissions, setting net-zero targets, and delivering carbon accounting insights across the enterprise.
  • Support target setting through economic and industry research, making powerpoint slides and reports, and presenting research to a wide range of internal stakeholders.
  • Collaborate with diverse internal stakeholders across business lines and functions to share E&S Risk data and insights, to inform risk management, business strategy, and ESG and climate disclosures.
  • Identify opportunities to improve environmental & social risk data processes and take a leading role in implementing these changes;
  • Optimize data quality and results by seeking out public and private data sources and working with internal stakeholders to source RBC data to improve our climate risk measurement and management capabilities.
  • Lead workstreams and collaborations across multiple teams to accomplish the above
  • Contribute to the development and management of junior members of the E&S Risk Analytics teams

Must have

  • An interest in Environmental and Social Risk in general and climate change in particular
  • Experience in working in an analytics team, especially those tasked with solving difficult and/or vaguely-defined problems
  • The ability to synthesize data into business insights and communicate these clearly to diverse audiences
  • An advanced understanding of programming and querying languages, including SQL and python OR a proven ability to both code in another data analytics language (e.g. R, MATLAB, SAS) and the ability learn a new language quickly
  • Experience developing presentations, visualizations and dashboards for senior executives and an interest in developing advanced analytical capabilities
  • Demonstrated ability in mathematical, statistical, financial or economic analyses on large, complex datasets and in translating data into business insights
  • A desire and proven ability to build new and innovative approaches to complex problems with minimal direction
  • Commitment to quality and accuracy with a high level of attention to detail.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Nice to have

  • Knowledge of climate change science with experience in the development and use of climate and economic scenarios, models, projections and data.
  • Knowledge or familiarity with the climate risk and/or target setting guidance issued by PCAF, NZBA, TCFD, ISSB, and/or OSFI (B-15)
  • Knowledge or familiarity with internal RBC wholesale lending data systems
  • Experience with or knowledge of carbon-intensive sectors, e.g. agriculture; aluminum; cement; coal; commercial and residential real estate; iron and steel; oil and gas; power generation; and transportation
  • Knowledge and experience in quantitative model development, testing and validation.
  • Experience working with a diverse range of stakeholders.
  • People manager experience

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work and make a difference
  • Opportunities to building close relationships

This position will support the advancement of the bank’s Environmental and Social Risk data management, analysis and disclosure capabilities, and the integration of this data into our risk management framework.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
Description

Our team and what we’ll accomplish together

Are you obsessed with data and identifying ways to harness and scale data intelligence across an entire organization? Do you love collaborating with fellow data professionals to develop innovative data solutions that lead to positive business outcomes? If your answer is yes, we would be delighted to have you onboard TELUS’ Data Strategy & Enablement team to provide vision and strategic guidance, while driving flawless execution on the development and evolution of large-scale machine learning environments.

You’ll be part of a multidisciplinary team of data wizards who are capitalizing on analytics and insights to deliver exceptional products and services for our customers. In turn, we hope you’ll enjoy being a valued member of Canada’s #1 global workplace with a world-leading culture featuring extensive community-giving initiatives, flexible work environment including remote work, award-winning opportunities for career development, and a competitive compensation and benefits package.

As a technology company, data is central to our mission to create better outcomes for our customers, especially as we strive to deliver next-generation networks like 5G; unlock the full potential of the Internet of Everything to power smart homes, businesses, industry, healthcare and cities; and deliver an incredible customer experience. Our Data Strategy & Enablement team is at the helm of building world-class data solutions by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced Augmented Intelligence (AI) tooling, high-quality data, and a data product and platform-oriented culture. At the same time, this team remains passionate champions of reliability, security and privacy by design, and is committed to creating the utmost level of privacy and security protections for all data on our networks and systems.

You’ll provide vision and strategic guidance to evolve from common static analysis to dynamic machine learning deployments, as well as expand our teams’ access to deep insights that improve the customer experience. You’ll work with a talented team of Data Scientists and other professionals to manage TELUS’ data platforms and offer the best possible analytics experience to internal stakeholders using the data. And finally, as a trusted advisor and partner, you’ll collaborate across various business units to accelerate the transformation of our platforms, improve the customer and team member experience, and drive business efficiencies.

What you’ll do

  • Build and maintain scalable data infrastructure that offers a best-in-class experience for internal stakeholders including consistent extraction of value from the data
  • Drive data ingestion and processing in innovative ways that inform strategic priorities and decision-making across the organization
  • Foster continuous systems transformation as we migrate infrastructure and applications to Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
  • Build expertise in the team to expose efficiency insights across data platforms in the cloud
  • Manage our cloud data analytics platform priorities to make sure data security and privacy are top considerations
  • Implement automation and monitoring tools through a test-driven approach and mindset
  • Drive the adoption of new cloud technologies to further advance TELUS’ data transformation strategy

  • You are recognized for your 8+ years of experience of IT platform implementation in a technical capacity

  • An expert understanding of data warehouses/cloud architectures and ETL processes
